Posts.Title: New to all this...... soclueless1 soclueless1

Posts.Content: soclueless1 wrote: Hello!!  So I'm VERY new to this.  I have to admit, I am so uneducated on all this and don't know where to start, what to push, what to leave alone and what to except.  On 02/08/13 a mass was found on my left breast during a routine doctor's appointment.  I was immediately scheduled for mammogram (last mammo was 04/12) on Wednesday 02/13/13.  The radiologist who looked at the mammo ordered an ultrasound for the next day due to both my breast are very dense.  The wording on the report is Breast Grade 3; breast tissue is heterogeneously dense.  The ultrasound confirmed the mass as well as a 2nd mass.  Both on my left breast.  It's worded as small predominant cystic nodular mass measuring 3.1mm.  Also included on the doctor report is Impression:  Somewhat complex probable cysts at the 11:00 position corresponding to a palpable abnormality.  A 6 month follow up study is suggested to assure stability.   Then of course it states BI-RADS 3.  Now, I only know all this as I requested to get the film and Final report so I could send it off for a 2nd opinion.  When I left the ultrasound appointment, I was told, this isn't cancer, don't worry about.  Now...I don't know what any of this means and what I should do.  This could mean nothing and to just simply follow up in 6 months.  However, since I don't know and don't know who to trust, I have no clue what to do.  I didn't realize there was a 2% chance this is cancer.   I just turned 40 last week and like I said....am a bit embarrassed to admit this is all so new to me. Any help or suggestions would be so appreciated.  Just have so may questions.   Thanks so much!!!!!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New to all this...... soclueless1 soclueless1

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2013 02:02AM soclueless1 wrote: Thank you all for your advice.  I forgot to mention I have very dense breasts so I do believe the MRI would be good.  But yes, cost is a concern.  On the other hand, my life and health has no costs associated with it.  :)  I'm great at speaking up when it comes to my children, me not so much.  They always come first so it's hard to take time and even think about me.    I will follow my doctors advice and see where to go from there.  It's all in God's hands anyway.  :)   This has been a great place for me in terms of discussion. I really have no idea what questions to ask, what direction to go and all I get from my family is...follow the doctors orders and leave it alone.  Sometimes, that's easier said then  done.  I'm sure I don't need to explain that to any of you....
Posts.Title: Advice.... soclueless1 fd1

Posts.Content: soclueless1 wrote: Hello!! Soooo new to this.  I actually posted something awhile ago about my situation.  A mass was discovered during a routine doctor visit.  I had a mammogram done which showed another mass.  The radiologist ordered an ultrasound which I had done the next day.  Turns out one of them is a somewhat complex probable cyst.  MY OBGYN sent me to a breast specialist.  The BS didn't seem too concerned.  When my husband asked questions to get a feel for if this was something to worry about..the doctor said, "I don't think this smells like anything."  Okay..good news right??  Well, he gave me 3 options for next treatment.  1) Wait 6 months and recheck.  2) MRI 3) he said I'll walk you over now and biopsy it.  I asked him what he thought I should do as I'm not a doctor.  :)  He said He'd like to do an MRI.  The problem could be if health insurance approves it.  Well..insurance did and I'm having that done next week.  Now I wonder if I made the right choice.  Should I just have had a biopsy done?? Can an MRI tell me what we need it to tell me?  Of course at what point do I just let the doctor do his job too and stop stressing over it.  Anyway, as this is all new to me, I just don't know what steps I should take, when to speak up and when to shut up.  :)  I am 40 years old and my grandmother had BC at the age of 78.  I do realize that a BIRAD 3 is only a 2% chance.  BUT, if it is, I'd like to deal with it now vs. later.  Any advice would be appreciated.  I think my family is over me stressing about it.  Which, I kind of understand.  :) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Advice.... soclueless1 fd1
